docs.snippet: Asian shares slipped on Tuesday amid escalating trade tensions and worries over the fading outlook for global tech giants, but investors held their nerves to focus instead on prospects for stronger world growth.

headline.main: Asian Investors Stay Calm Amid Wall Street Sell-Off

docs.snippet: Charles H. Rivkin, an assistant secretary of state during the Obama administration, is now the chairman of the Motion Picture Association of America. He takes over in a time of upheaval.

headline.main: Hollywood’s Ambassador, Schooled in Diplomacy and the Muppets
headline.print_headline: Hollywood’s Envoy, Schooled In Diplomacy (and Muppets)

docs.snippet: Spotify is a loss-making company that might not report a profit until next decade, but that didn’t stop investors from valuing the company at $30 billion.

headline.main: A Big Reason Wall Street Is Flocking to Spotify: DealBook Briefing

docs.snippet: Mexican politicians put aside differences Thursday to condemn U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to deploy National Guard troops to the border.

headline.main: Mexican Politicians Unite to Slam Deployment of US Guardsmen

docs.snippet: In a tight labor market, positions in poultry plants and lumber mills can be tough to fill. But that spells opportunity for recruiters like Ray Wiley.

docs.snippet: The Trump administration is weighing further retaliation against Russia for meddling in the election and interfering in the affairs of the United States and its allies, the top U.S. intelligence official said Wednesday.

headline.main: Top Spy Official: US Will Take More Steps Against Russia
headline.print_headline: Top Spy Official: US Will Take More Steps Against Russia

docs.snippet: Shares in U.S. exporters of everything from planes to tractors were volatile on Wednesday after China proposed duties on key U.S. imports including soybeans, planes, cars, beef and chemicals in retaliation to Trump administration tariff plans.

headline.main: China Trade Retaliation Puts Stocks of U.S. Exporters in Spin
headline.print_headline: China Trade Retaliation Puts Stocks of U.S. Exporters in Spin

docs.snippet: China's manufacturing activity expanded at its weakest pace in four months in March as export demand faltered, prompting companies to shed staff more quickly as they looked to cut costs, a private survey showed on Monday.

headline.main: China March Factory Growth Cools to Four-Month Low-Caixin PMI
headline.print_headline: China March Factory Growth Cools to Four-Month Low-Caixin PMI
